img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.span: Due to Covid-19 restrictions, Kindergarten registration is taking place online this year. Please fill out the form once for each child being enrolled in Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year. There is a link for those using a Google account, and a different link if you have an email that is not Google based.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; color: #222222; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: Dual Immersion – Dual immersion is planned for full day kindergarten

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; color: #222222; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: Full Day Kindergarten – Full day kindergarten (all day) is the same schedule as grades 1-3 Monday-Friday.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; color: #222222; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;
p.span: Transportation – At this time, no mid-day transportation is planned. Students who attend half-day kindergarten will need to be picked up or dropped off by a parent or day care.

span.a: Click here for a list of offers for free or reduced internet in Idaho

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.a: Click here for a list of offers for free or reduced internet in Idaho

p.br: Jerome School District Parents and Staff:

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; color: #222222; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

div.p: The State Board of Education voted today to continue the soft closure of all Idaho schools for the remainder of the school year. They did leave a possibility for an individual school district to reopen if certain criteria are met and the district works with their local public health department.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; color: #222222; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

div.p: So, What does this mean? The soft closure expectation from the state is that we continue to make our best effort in providing an education for our students. Our staff will continue to work with parents and students in this difficult time. Please communicate with your student’s school and teacher as questions and concerns arise.

p.style: margin: 0in 0in 8pt; color: #222222; line-height: 15.6933px; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

p.span: Dual Immersion is a program that offers a rich bilingual experience for young learners when their minds are developmentally best able to acquire a second language. Instruction is divided between two high quality, creative classrooms: one English and one in Spanish. Jerome Schools has a 2-way Spanish Dual Language Immersion program that started in 2016 with Kindergarten and 1st grade and has expanded by a grade level each year. In 2020, 5th grade will be added and will continue expansion into the Middle School (2021) and High School (2024). The mission of the JSD DLI program is for participants to become highly bi-literate, bi-cultural, and bi-lingual members of society.

br.span: We are pleased to open the application for the 2020-2021 Dual Immersion Cohort. Applications and parent commitment forms are due to Jefferson Elementary by Friday, May 1, 2020 at 3:30PM. All applications received by that time will be given an equal opportunity at placement in the program. In lieu of the Parent Information Night on April 24th, families who submit applications will be asked to view a short video and complete a survey. Please submit your application to Jefferson Elementary and you will be sent the link for viewing.

p.span: Families are also welcome to submit applications for students in grades 1-5, though placement on the waiting list is subject to further assessment and considerations.

Please feel free to call Jefferson Elementary at 208-324-8896 if you have any questions. We look forward to receiving your applications and starting the journey to biliteracy with our 6th cohort this fall!

span.a: JSD Dual Immersion Application (English and Spanish)

strong.img:
English
English Spanish
Optional Full Day Kindergarten Available in Jerome School District

p.span: Idaho Governor Brad Little formed a task force in May of last year to review the priorities of Idaho K-12 public education. Over the last several months, the 26-member task force named “Our Kids, Idaho’s Future” developed five recommendations on which to focus. Two of these recommendations focus on

early literacy. Recommendation 1 is a focus on kindergarten through third grade literacy and recommendation 2 is to provide greater All-Day Kindergarten opportunities to support K-3 literacy and future student achievement.

br.span: In conjunction with these recommendations, the state provides each school district with money targeted specifically to improve literacy in the early grades. Many districts, including Jerome, are using part of this funding to provide an optional full day kindergarten program to give students more time in
the early years of learning. The district is excited about this opportunity and are in the planning stages to begin next year.

Classroom space is a challenge in the growing district, so additional classrooms are being added to the current Jerome Early Education Program (J.E.E.P) building located on the Horizon Elementary campus. These new classrooms are being funded through the district plant facilities account.

Kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 school year is April 14-15 at the district office gym located at 125 4 th Avenue West. Students must turn 5 years of age on or before September 1, to be eligible to attend kindergarten. Bring birth certificates and current immunization records when registering your child for kindergarten. During this time parents can let the district know if they want their child to attend the traditional half-day kindergarten schedule or if a full-day schedule will benefit their student.
